intro: Parosela laxiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered parosela, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, small flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in coastal areas. Its leaves are fern-like and finely divided, while its flowers are white or pale green. Parosela laxiflora is relatively rare and is often found in specific microhabitats within its native range.
